column4: hey.  What can I do to stop fsck from complaining on boot and throwing me into a maintenance prompt after changing partitions?  I can boot as normal by exiting the maintenance prompt with ^d but I don't want to have to do that every time I reboot
there is a checkfs.sh or somesuch in /etc/init.d/  you can either sudo chmod -x /etc/init.d/whatever or sudo update-rc.d -f whatever remove
I really want to be able to have the filesystem checked tho
